newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul BOK to supply 500 bln won to banking system.
newsitem.headline: Seoul BOK to supply 500 bln won to banking system.

text.p: The Bank of Korea plans to supply 500 billion won to the banking system on Thursday through overnight repurchase agreements to ease liquidity shortages, an official at the central bank said.
"Today's money supply will help banks meet their daily required reserve levels and reduce accumulated reserve shortages," said the official.
On Wednesday the overnight call rate fell slightly to 11.47 percent from the previous day's 11.50 percent largely due to the central bank's supply of one trillion won to the banks.
But bond market dealers said traders were still worried that the liquidity shortage could continue.
